column3:
tACK b440aca96a338f16ca664065821b980c4b0537ae.

Adjusted test commands:
````
bitcoind -regtest -rpcbind=::1 -rpcallowip=0.0.0.0/0 -debug=http
bitcoin-cli -regtest -rpcconnect=::1 getblockchaininfo
````

Relevant parts of bitcoind console messages:
````
....
2020-06-25T10:21:59Z Command-line arg: debug="http"
2020-06-25T10:21:59Z Command-line arg: regtest=""
2020-06-25T10:

Just a clarification to "how" this is working, and follow up to the comments above. By default, the mingw32 compiler, (on my machine, `x86_64-w64-mingw32-g++ (GCC) 9.3.0`) will set `_WIN32_WINNT` to 0x0502 ([Windows Server 2003](https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/cpp/porting/modifying-winver-and-win32-winnt?view=vs-2019)).\n\nSo the fix here isn't just that we are overriding libevents internal `_W

### Gitian builds | File | commit f32f7e907a5eb73e880c567c699569081608ed7a
(master) | commit 7b0e5ab7cdd87dab8e8223929b3c748e23a95daf
(master and this pull) | |--|--|--| | bitcoin-core-linux-0.21-res.yml | [`0c3497a54c3bc7ba...`](https://drahtbot.space/gitian/bitcoin/bitcoin/f32f7e907a5eb73e880c567c699569081608ed7a/bitcoin-core-linux-0.21-res.yml
I don't see how this can work... evutil.c `#undef _WIN32_WINNT`

It's only [undef'd](https://github.com/libevent/libevent/blob/45c3fc29fb2240dbaa066c971f3fd59861293305/evutil.c#L43) after the inclusion of [`ws2tcpip.h`](https://github.com/libevent/libevent/blob/45c3fc29fb2240dbaa066c971f3fd59861293305/evutil.c#L33) which is where the `AI_*` definitions are.

In the `ws2tcpip.h` header on my machine I've got:
```c
#define AI_PASSIVE                  0x00
Oh, weird. That seems like it's probably a bug, but not our problem.
You might want to add a comment here in the makefile about why this is defined, and why it works.

@laanwj I've added a comment here. These kinds of details probably deserve a separate document in depends (we could also add some of the macOS stuff there as well). I can follow up by writing up some more extensive docs.
